whatIsMewDesc1: MyEtherWallet(MEW) is a free, open-source, client-side interface. MEW allows you to interact directly with the blockchain, while remaining in full control of your keys and funds.
whatIsMewDesc2: Did you read that? YOU are the one who is in control. MEW is not a bank or exchange, we are an interface. This means we don't hold your keys or information, but it also means we can't access accounts, recover keys, reset passwords, or reverse transactions.
whatIsMewWarning: WARNING: You And Only You Are Responsible For Your Security.
whereAreMyFundsDesc: Your tokens and coins are not on MyEtherWallet. Just like they aren't on your hardware wallet, on MetaMask, or on blockchain explorers. All funds on the blockchain itself. This means that we do not control them. We are only a doorway to interact with them.
whereAreMyFundsWarning: WARNING: MyEtherWallet Does Not Control Your Funds. You Do!
whatIsBlockchainDesc1: The term 'blockchain' refers to a public, decentalized spreadsheet, similar to a ledger. It's maintained by people all over the world, who remotely mine transaction to make them a park of the blockchain, permanently.
whatIsBlockchainDesc2: When you use MEW, you are accessing the blockchain directly. We are not responsible for theft caused by user error. Please do your research, knowledge is power! Learn more about MyEtherWallet and the Ethereum blockchain
lostPasswordTitle: What if I lose my keys or password?
lostPasswordDescHalf: We can not recover your information for you. If you lose your information, it's
lostPasswordDescCont: MEW doesn't store any data. After you've received your keys and set up a password, we strongly suggest you:
lostPasswordDescOpt1: Write Your Keys And Password Down. Keep Them Safe.
lostPasswordDescOpt2: Don't Store Your Keys And Password on Your Computer or Phone.
tip1Title: Never give your Private Key to anyone
tip1Desc: That includes your keystore file and mnemonic phrase.
tip2Desc: If they're giving away free ETH, it's not real. If they email you saying they're us, it's not real. If they ask for your private key, it's not real.
tip3Desc: Always check the URL for our 'MyEtherWallet Inc [US]' certification. And install our Chrome extension for an extra layer of security!
tip3DescCont: for an extra layer of security!
tip4Desc: We have many great hardware wallets listed on our interface. They're only about $100. It's worth for your security. Buy one here.
tip5Desc: Please feel free to contact us. Our email is
congratulationsDesc: You have read through our warning slides, and you're ready to dive in. If you want to know more, please head to our
congratulationsDescCont: . We have many articles to assist you!
